meanings.definition: Not under the control or in the power of another; able to act or be done as one wishes.
meanings.sent1: She felt free to choose her own path in life.
meanings.sent2: The bird flew freely in the open sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to think it was free to boss around the dog.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was free like a bird soaring high above all worries.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of freedom enveloped her like a warm embrace.

meanings.definition: Not physically restrained, obstructed, or fixed; unimpeded.
meanings.sent1: The river flowed free without any obstacles in its way.
meanings.sent2: The children ran freely in the spacious park.
meanings.sent3: The kite danced in the sky, feeling completely free from the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as free and infectious as a summer breeze.
meanings.sent5: The horse galloped freely across the vast meadow.

meanings.definition: Not subject to or constrained by a particular condition or circumstance.
meanings.sent1: He enjoyed the free time to explore his hobbies.
meanings.sent2: The artist's creativity flowed freely without any restrictions.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a free lunch always made him suspicious.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt free from the weight of past regrets.
meanings.sent5: The concept of freedom was as clear and pure as a crystal stream.

meanings.definition: Not subject to or constrained by a particular condition or circumstance.
meanings.sent1: The students were free to express their opinions in class.
meanings.sent2: The wind blew freely through the open window.
meanings.sent3: The cat believed it was free to nap on the dog's bed.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit soared free like a kite in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of liberation was as free-flowing as a river.
